findings.title: Root User Has Active Access Keys
findings.description: The root user account has active access keys.
findings.recommendation: Delete all root user access keys immediately
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: Root User MFA Not Enabled
findings.description: Multi-factor authentication is not enabled on the root account.
findings.recommendation: Enable MFA on root account immediately
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: IAM Password Policy: Minimum Length Too Short
findings.description: Password minimum length is 8 (CIS requires >= 14 characters).
findings.recommendation: Update password policy to require minimum 14 characters
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: IAM User Console Access Without MFA
findings.description: IAM user 'john.doe' has console access but no MFA device configured.
findings.recommendation: Enable MFA for all IAM users with console access
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: IAM Policy Grants Full Administrative Privileges
findings.description: IAM policy 'AdminPolicy' grants full *:* administrative privileges.
findings.recommendation: Replace with specific permissions following principle of least privilege
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: S3 Bucket Does Not Enforce HTTPS
findings.description: S3 bucket does not have a policy to deny HTTP requests.
findings.recommendation: Add bucket policy to deny requests where aws:SecureTransport is false
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: S3 Block Public Access Not Fully Enabled
findings.description: S3 bucket does not have all Block Public Access settings enabled.
findings.recommendation: Enable all Block Public Access settings
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: RDS Instance Publicly Accessible
findings.description: RDS instance is publicly accessible from the internet.
findings.recommendation: Modify RDS instance to disable public accessibility
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: CloudTrail Not Enabled in All Regions
findings.description: No multi-region CloudTrail trail is enabled.
findings.recommendation: Create and enable a multi-region CloudTrail trail
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: CloudTrail Logs Not Encrypted with KMS
findings.description: CloudTrail trail does not use KMS encryption.
findings.recommendation: Enable KMS encryption for CloudTrail logs
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: VPC Flow Logging Not Enabled
findings.description: VPC does not have flow logging enabled.
findings.recommendation: Enable VPC flow logs
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: AWS Security Hub Not Enabled
findings.description: AWS Security Hub is not enabled in this region.
findings.recommendation: Enable AWS Security Hub for centralized security findings
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: Security Group Allows SSH from Internet
findings.description: Security group allows SSH (port 22) from 0.0.0.0/0.
findings.recommendation: Restrict SSH access to specific IP ranges
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: Default Security Group Allows Traffic
findings.description: Default security group has rules allowing traffic.
findings.recommendation: Remove all rules from default security group
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: EC2 Instance Not Enforcing IMDSv2
findings.description: EC2 instance does not enforce IMDSv2.
findings.recommendation: Modify instance metadata options to require IMDSv2
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v6.0.0

findings.title: AMI EBS Snapshots Not Encrypted
findings.description: AMI 'web-app-v1.0' has unencrypted EBS snapshots. Data at rest is not encrypted.
findings.recommendation: Copy AMI with encryption enabled using 'aws ec2 copy-image --encrypted'
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: AMI Older Than 90 Days
findings.description: AMI 'api-backend-v2.0' is 145 days old. Outdated AMIs may lack security patches.
findings.recommendation: Create new AMI from updated instance and deregister old AMI
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: EBS Encryption By Default Not Enabled
findings.description: EBS encryption by default is not enabled for this region.
findings.recommendation: Enable EBS encryption by default
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: EBS Snapshot Not Encrypted
findings.description: EBS snapshot 'prod-db-backup' is not encrypted.
findings.recommendation: Create new encrypted snapshot and delete unencrypted snapshot
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: Unused EBS Volume Detected
findings.description: EBS volume is not attached to any instance.
findings.recommendation: Review volume and delete if no longer needed
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: EC2 Instance Using Default Security Group
findings.description: EC2 instance is using the default security group.
findings.recommendation: Create custom security group with least privilege
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: IMDSv2 Not Enforced on EC2 Instance
findings.description: EC2 instance does not enforce IMDSv2.
findings.recommendation: Enforce IMDSv2 to protect against SSRF attacks
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: Potential Secrets in EC2 User Data
findings.description: EC2 User Data may contain sensitive information.
findings.recommendation: Use AWS Secrets Manager instead
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: ECS Task with Host Network Has Privileged Access
findings.description: ECS task using host network mode allows privileged access.
findings.recommendation: Remove privileged access or run as non-root user
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: ECS Container Running in Privileged Mode
findings.description: ECS container is running in privileged mode.
findings.recommendation: Remove privileged flag
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: ECS Container Has Secrets in Environment Variables
findings.description: ECS container has potential secret in environment variable 'API_KEY'.
findings.recommendation: Use AWS Secrets Manager instead
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: Lambda Function Has Overly Permissive IAM Role
findings.description: Lambda function has AdministratorAccess policy attached.
findings.recommendation: Replace with custom policy granting only required permissions
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: Lambda Function Publicly Accessible
findings.description: Lambda function has public access policy.
findings.recommendation: Remove public access and grant permissions to specific principals
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: Lambda Function Using Deprecated Runtime
findings.description: Lambda function uses deprecated runtime 'python3.6'.
findings.recommendation: Update to a currently supported runtime version
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0

findings.title: Aurora Cluster Not Encrypted at Rest
findings.description: Aurora cluster 'aurora-cluster-prod-001' does not have encryption at rest enabled. Data stored is not encrypted.
findings.recommendation: Enable encryption at rest for the Aurora cluster using AWS KMS. Note: This requires creating a new encrypted cluster and migrating data.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: SSL/TLS Not Enforced for Aurora Connections
findings.description: Aurora cluster does not enforce SSL/TLS for client connections. Data in transit may not be encrypted.
findings.recommendation: Configure Aurora to require SSL/TLS connections and update client applications to use SSL certificates.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: Aurora Audit Logging Not Enabled
findings.description: Database Activity Streams or CloudTrail logging is not enabled for Aurora cluster.
findings.recommendation: Enable Amazon RDS Database Activity Streams or configure CloudTrail logging for comprehensive audit trails.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: Aurora Master Password Not Recently Rotated
findings.description: The master password for Aurora cluster has not been rotated in over 90 days.
findings.recommendation: Rotate the master password regularly (at least every 90 days) following your organization's password policy.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: Aurora Backup Retention Period Too Short
findings.description: Aurora cluster has a backup retention period of only 1 day. This may not meet compliance requirements.
findings.recommendation: Configure backup retention period to at least 7 days, or longer based on compliance requirements.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: RDS Instance Not Encrypted at Rest
findings.description: RDS instance 'rds-mysql-prod-db' does not have encryption at rest enabled.
findings.recommendation: Enable encryption at rest for RDS instance using AWS KMS. Requires creating a snapshot, copying with encryption, and restoring.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: RDS SSL/TLS Connection Not Enforced
findings.description: RDS instance does not enforce SSL/TLS connections. Database connections may be unencrypted.
findings.recommendation: Configure RDS parameter group to require SSL and update application connection strings to use SSL.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: RDS Auto Minor Version Upgrade Disabled
findings.description: RDS instance does not have auto minor version upgrade enabled, potentially missing security patches.
findings.recommendation: Enable auto minor version upgrade in RDS instance settings to automatically apply security patches.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: RDS Enhanced Monitoring Not Enabled
findings.description: Enhanced Monitoring is not enabled for RDS instance, limiting visibility into database performance.
findings.recommendation: Enable Enhanced Monitoring for RDS instance to collect metrics at 1-60 second intervals.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: RDS Automated Backups Retention Too Short
findings.description: RDS automated backup retention period is set to 1 day, which may not meet compliance requirements.
findings.recommendation: Configure automated backup retention period to at least 7 days or as required by compliance policies.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: RDS Instance Not in VPC
findings.description: RDS instance is using EC2-Classic platform instead of VPC, lacking modern network security controls.
findings.recommendation: Migrate RDS instance to VPC for improved network isolation and security group controls.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DynamoDB Table Not Encrypted at Rest
findings.description: DynamoDB table 'users' does not have encryption at rest enabled using AWS KMS.
findings.recommendation: Enable encryption at rest for DynamoDB table using AWS KMS customer managed keys (CMK).
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DynamoDB Client Not Using HTTPS
findings.description: Application connections to DynamoDB are not enforcing HTTPS/TLS encryption.
findings.recommendation: Configure application to use HTTPS endpoints and enforce TLS 1.2 or higher for DynamoDB connections.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DynamoDB VPC Endpoint Not Configured
findings.description: VPC does not have a VPC endpoint for DynamoDB, forcing traffic over public internet.
findings.recommendation: Create a VPC endpoint for DynamoDB to keep traffic within AWS network.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DynamoDB CloudTrail Logging Not Enabled
findings.description: CloudTrail logging is not enabled for DynamoDB API calls, limiting audit capabilities.
findings.recommendation: Enable CloudTrail logging for DynamoDB to track all API calls and data plane operations.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: ElastiCache Cluster Not Encrypted at Rest
findings.description: ElastiCache Redis cluster does not have encryption at rest enabled.
findings.recommendation: Enable encryption at rest for ElastiCache cluster. Note: Requires creating a new cluster with encryption enabled.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: ElastiCache In-Transit Encryption Not Enabled
findings.description: ElastiCache Redis cluster does not have in-transit encryption (TLS) enabled.
findings.recommendation: Enable in-transit encryption for ElastiCache Redis cluster to protect data during transmission.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: ElastiCache Cluster Not in VPC
findings.description: ElastiCache cluster is not deployed in a VPC, lacking network isolation.
findings.recommendation: Migrate ElastiCache cluster to VPC for improved network security and isolation.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: ElastiCache AUTH Token Not Configured
findings.description: Redis AUTH token is not configured for ElastiCache cluster, allowing unauthenticated access.
findings.recommendation: Configure Redis AUTH token to require password authentication for all connections.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: ElastiCache CloudWatch Logs Not Enabled
findings.description: Slow log delivery to CloudWatch is not enabled for ElastiCache Redis cluster.
findings.recommendation: Enable slow log delivery to CloudWatch Logs for monitoring and troubleshooting.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DocumentDB Cluster Not Encrypted at Rest
findings.description: DocumentDB cluster does not have encryption at rest enabled using AWS KMS.
findings.recommendation: Enable encryption at rest for DocumentDB cluster. Note: Requires creating a new encrypted cluster and migrating data.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DocumentDB TLS Not Enforced
findings.description: DocumentDB cluster does not enforce TLS for client connections.
findings.recommendation: Enable TLS enforcement in DocumentDB cluster parameter group and update client applications to use TLS.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DocumentDB Audit Logging Not Enabled
findings.description: Audit logging is not enabled for DocumentDB cluster, limiting compliance and forensic capabilities.
findings.recommendation: Enable audit logging in DocumentDB cluster parameter group and export logs to CloudWatch Logs.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: DocumentDB Backup Retention Too Short
findings.description: DocumentDB cluster backup retention period is only 1 day, which may not meet compliance requirements.
findings.recommendation: Configure backup retention period to at least 7 days or as required by organizational policies.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: Neptune Cluster Not Encrypted at Rest
findings.description: Neptune cluster does not have encryption at rest enabled using AWS KMS.
findings.recommendation: Enable encryption at rest for Neptune cluster. Requires creating a new encrypted cluster and migrating data.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: Neptune SSL/TLS Not Enforced
findings.description: Neptune cluster does not enforce SSL/TLS for client connections.
findings.recommendation: Configure Neptune to require SSL/TLS connections and update client applications to use encrypted connections.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: Neptune IAM Database Authentication Not Enabled
findings.description: IAM database authentication is not enabled for Neptune cluster, relying only on database passwords.
findings.recommendation: Enable IAM database authentication for Neptune to use IAM roles and temporary credentials.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

findings.title: Neptune Audit Logging Not Enabled
findings.description: Audit logs are not being exported to CloudWatch Logs for Neptune cluster.
findings.recommendation: Enable audit log export to CloudWatch Logs in Neptune cluster configuration.
findings.compliance_standard: CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0

compliance_standards: CIS AWS Compute Services Benchmark v1.1.0
CIS AWS Database Services Benchmark v1.0.0
